text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale today since all

show you how I make my vegetable stock
it is not revolutionary by any means but
I promise you it is absolutely delicious
it's really easy it requires a handful
of basic ingredients but this is sort of
like my method to getting really sort of
delicious sweet and tense veggie stock
that can be used in a million different
ways alright so this is a very first
step I want to show you the ingredients
I like to use for my veggie stock which
is just carrots celery onion and I've
got some tomatoes and lots of garlic and
as you can see I have sort of chopped
these roughly I didn't even peel the
onions I went ahead and added the little
tops of the celery as well I didn't peel
the carrots didn't peel the garlic none
of it matters in fact the color from the

like intensified that rich color even
more so that's perfectly its perfect
here but those very outer layers of
carrots and carrots
of onion I did remove just because they
sort of fly off all over the place
alright I've got my oven preheated to
425 because I'm going to roast my

25 minutes or so in a hot oven it allows
that sweetness the natural sweetness of
the veggies to really intensify and then
when you add them to a pot and you
simmer them for a long time they just
get sweeter and sweeter and they've got
that extra layer of flavor from the
roast
you know from roasting them so it's
amazing so to this I need to add just a

and as you can see I put them on a
baking sheet that's big enough for
everything to be laid out in one layer
because I don't want these esteem I want
them to roast if they're all on top of
each other really crowded in a small pan
they'll steam and not roast and they
won't develop
the color which is what I want all right
I'm going to pop this into a hot oven

these are looking fantastic they were in

now the only other additional

bay has a really wonderful flavor

dry is great for me because I don't have

full of options you can do what I'm
